summary: This is an email chain between FBI agents discussing coordination for victim interviews in Florida following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest. New York agents inform Tampa field office they will be traveling to interview approximately 25 victims, with two located in Winter Gardens and Palm Harbor areas.

persons.name: SSRA FBI Tampa
persons.context: Responds to New York agents' notification about victim interviews in Florida, offering assistance from the Crimes Against Children Task Force in Palm Harbor.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20
persons.context: Initiates the email chain to notify Tampa field office about New York agents traveling to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims following Epstein's arrest.

connections.description: New York FBI agent coordinates with Tampa FBI agent regarding victim interviews in Florida following Epstein's arrest.

events.title: FBI Coordination for Victim Interviews
events.description: FBI agents from New York notify Tampa field office they will be traveling to Florida to interview approximately 25 victims of Jeffrey Epstein, with interviews starting the next day.

events.title: Epstein Arrest and Indictment
events.description: Reference to Jeffrey Epstein's arrest and indictment that prompted the FBI's victim interview operation.

keyFacts: Following Epstein's arrest and indictment, FBI agents planned to interview approximately 25 victims in Florida.
Most victims were located in the Miami/West Palm Beach area, with two specifically in Winter Gardens and Palm Harbor.
The email chain shows coordination between FBI New York and FBI Tampa field offices for victim interviews.
The Crimes Against Children Task Force in Palm Harbor was offered to assist with the investigation.
New York agents were flying to Florida on July 9, 2019, with interviews scheduled to begin the next day.
